result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James D Fuerstenau

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 31, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Bond returned for RCJ Missing 2nd page with Clerk's Signature.

ADDRESS INFO for James D Fuerstenau
Current: 2459A S. 8th St, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 10-12-2022)
Prior: 830 N 19Th St, Milwaukee, WI 53233

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance. Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

10:15 AM Defendant James D Fuerstenau in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn in court for James D Fuerstenau.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Matter was scheduled for change of plea.
Defense is requesting a new date to prepare for plea and sentencing.
Defense is requesting to be heard on bond this morning.
No motion has been filed.
State is not objecting to be heard on bond.
Defense is requesting that bond be modified to a signature bond in the amount of $1500.
State is objecting to any bond modification.
BTC: Modify bond to a $1500 signature bond, all prior conditions remain, matter adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
